title: Greek Love: Eros, Philia, and Agape
description: One-minute skill: Greek Love: Eros, Philia, and Agape.

hook.text: The ancient Greeks had six words for love. English has one. That says everything about our confusion.

buildup.text: Eros was passionate desire. Philia was deep friendship. Agape was selfless, unconditional love for all.

discovery.text: Plato argued that Eros could transcend the body and become a love of wisdom â€” 'Platonic love' was born.

twist.text: The Greeks feared Eros. They saw passionate love as madness â€” a loss of reason, not a gift.

climax.text: Greek love was layered and nuanced. Modern love collapses all six types into one overwhelming word.

punchline.text: The Greeks had six kinds of love. We try to fit all six into one.
